content: 11 12 cc blocks in the colourwork section but don t let this restrict you so long as you have enough yarn you can knit this hat to a length of your preference please note that the colours and cc numbers on the chart are for illustration purposes only when you have gathered and weighed your yarn arrange it in a way that inspires you i went for a rainbow for my original design but this pattern gives you the freedom to go wild you could a try lucky dip style pop all your scrappies in your project bag and knit with whatever you pull out if you don t have enough yarn right now you could add to your hat each time you finish a dk project it will be like a time-line colour sampler hat of all your previous woolly projects once you have established the colourwork pattern this project flies off the needles and it s so exciting to see all your scrappies come together into a beautiful hat i ll warn you now it s seriously addictive when it comes to the rounds where you are knitting with two yarns at the same time do what is most comfortable for you my preference is to knit with one yarn in each hand holding the most recently introduced cc in my right hand and switching the yarn i have just knit the two k rounds with to my left to knit continental style due to the scrappy nature of the freedom collection you will naturally have a lot of yarn ends to deal with i rather enjoy the process of sewing them all in at the end i find it quite meditative however if that isn t your jam it s worth looking up the weavin stephen or magic knot methods for dealing with them the most important thing with this pattern is to have fun just go for it happy knitting the freedom collection -
